trans-unit.source: Enumerates all uniquely-named fonts in the system that match the specified font characteristics

seg-source.mrk: Enumerates all uniquely-named fonts in the system that match the specified font characteristics

target.mrk: Enumerates all uniquely-named fonts in the system that match the specified font characteristics

trans-unit.source: [optional] A handle to the device context from which to enumerate the fonts.

seg-source.mrk: A handle to the device context from which to enumerate the fonts.

target.mrk: A handle to the device context from which to enumerate the fonts.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is 0, the function uses a DC for the application's current screen.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is 0, the function uses a DC for the application's current screen.

target.mrk: If this parameter is 0, the function uses a DC for the application's current screen.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The typeface name of the font.

seg-source.mrk: The typeface name of the font.

target.mrk: The typeface name of the font.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is an empty string (Default), the function enumerates one font is each available typeface name.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is an empty string (Default), the function enumerates one font is each available typeface name.

target.mrk: If this parameter is an empty string (Default), the function enumerates one font is each available typeface name.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is a valid typeface name, the function enumerates all fonts with the specified name.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is a valid typeface name, the function enumerates all fonts with the specified name.

target.mrk: If this parameter is a valid typeface name, the function enumerates all fonts with the specified name.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The character set. It can be one of the following predefined values.

seg-source.mrk: It can be one of the following predefined values.

target.mrk: It can be one of the following predefined values.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is set to $DEFAULT_CHARSET (Default), the function enumerates all uniquely-named fonts in all character sets.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is set to $DEFAULT_CHARSET (Default), the function enumerates all uniquely-named fonts in all character sets.

target.mrk: If this parameter is set to $DEFAULT_CHARSET (Default), the function enumerates all uniquely-named fonts in all character sets.

trans-unit.source: If there are two fonts with the same name, only one is enumerated.

seg-source.mrk: If there are two fonts with the same name, only one is enumerated.

target.mrk: If there are two fonts with the same name, only one is enumerated.

trans-unit.source: If this parameter is set to a valid character set value, the function enumerates only fonts in the specified character set.

seg-source.mrk: If this parameter is set to a valid character set value, the function enumerates only fonts in the specified character set.

target.mrk: If this parameter is set to a valid character set value, the function enumerates only fonts in the specified character set.

trans-unit.source: Middle East language edition of Windows:

seg-source.mrk: Middle East language edition of Windows:

target.mrk: Middle East language edition of Windows:

trans-unit.source: [optional] The type of the fonts to enumerating. This parameter can be 0 (vector fonts), (-1) (all fonts), or any combination of the following values.

seg-source.mrk: The type of the fonts to enumerating.
This parameter can be 0 (vector fonts), (-1) (all fonts), or any combination of the following values.

target.mrk: The type of the fonts to enumerating.
This parameter can be 0 (vector fonts), (-1) (all fonts), or any combination of the following values.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The pattern string to include (exclude) the fonts in (from) the enumerating.

seg-source.mrk: The pattern string to include (exclude) the fonts in (from) the enumerating.

target.mrk: The pattern string to include (exclude) the fonts in (from) the enumerating.

trans-unit.source: This makes sense only if the typeface name is not specified. This string can contain wildcard characters.

seg-source.mrk: This makes sense only if the typeface name is not specified.
This string can contain wildcard characters.

target.mrk: This makes sense only if the typeface name is not specified.
This string can contain wildcard characters.

trans-unit.source: The pattern will be ignored if this parameter is omitted or an empty string.

seg-source.mrk: The pattern will be ignored if this parameter is omitted or an empty string.

target.mrk: The pattern will be ignored if this parameter is omitted or an empty string.

trans-unit.source: [optional] Specifies whether to use the pattern to exclude the fonts, valid values:

seg-source.mrk: Specifies whether to use the pattern to exclude the fonts, valid values:

target.mrk: Specifies whether to use the pattern to exclude the fonts, valid values:

trans-unit.source: The 2D array containing the following information:

seg-source.mrk: The 2D array containing the following information:

target.mrk: The 2D array containing the following information:

trans-unit.source: [n][0] - The typeface name of the font.

seg-source.mrk: [n][0] - The typeface name of the font.

target.mrk: [n][0] - The typeface name of the font.

trans-unit.source: [n][2] - The unique name of the font.

seg-source.mrk: [n][2] - The unique name of the font.

target.mrk: [n][2] - The unique name of the font.

trans-unit.source: [n][3] - The script, that is, the character set, of the font.

seg-source.mrk: [n][3] - The script, that is, the character set, of the font.

target.mrk: [n][3] - The script, that is, the character set, of the font.

trans-unit.source: [n][5] - The pitch, technology, and family of the font (same as in the TEXTMETRIC structure).

seg-source.mrk: [n][5] - The pitch, technology, and family of the font (same as in the TEXTMETRIC structure).

target.mrk: [n][5] - The pitch, technology, and family of the font (same as in the TEXTMETRIC structure).

trans-unit.source: [n][6] - The character set of the font ($*_CHARSET).

seg-source.mrk: [n][6] - The character set of the font ($*_CHARSET).

target.mrk: [n][6] - The character set of the font ($*_CHARSET).

trans-unit.source: The fonts for many East Asian languages have two typeface names: an English name and a localized name.

seg-source.mrk: The fonts for many East Asian languages have two typeface names: an English name and a localized name.

target.mrk: The fonts for many East Asian languages have two typeface names: an English name and a localized name.

trans-unit.source: The function returns the English typeface name if the system locale does not match the language of the font.

seg-source.mrk: The function returns the English typeface name if the system locale does not match the language of the font.

target.mrk: The function returns the English typeface name if the system locale does not match the language of the font.

trans-unit.source: When the graphics mode on the device context is set to $GM_ADVANCED and the $DEVICE_FONTTYPE flag is specified,

seg-source.mrk: When the graphics mode on the device context is set to $GM_ADVANCED and the $DEVICE_FONTTYPE flag is specified,

target.mrk: When the graphics mode on the device context is set to $GM_ADVANCED and the $DEVICE_FONTTYPE flag is specified,

trans-unit.source: _WinAPI_EnumFontFamilies() returns a list of Type 1 and OpenType fonts on the system.

seg-source.mrk: _WinAPI_EnumFontFamilies() returns a list of Type 1 and OpenType fonts on the system.

target.mrk: _WinAPI_EnumFontFamilies() returns a list of Type 1 and OpenType fonts on the system.

trans-unit.source: When the graphics mode is not set to $GM_ADVANCED, this function returns a list of Type 1, OpenType, and TrueType fonts on the system.

seg-source.mrk: When the graphics mode is not set to $GM_ADVANCED, this function returns a list of Type 1, OpenType, and TrueType fonts on the system.

target.mrk: When the graphics mode is not set to $GM_ADVANCED, this function returns a list of Type 1, OpenType, and TrueType fonts on the system.

trans-unit.source: Enumerates all uniquely-named fonts excluding "@" fonts, which is designed for vertical text, in the ANSI character set

seg-source.mrk: Enumerates all uniquely-named fonts excluding "@" fonts, which is designed for vertical text, in the ANSI character set

target.mrk: Enumerates all uniquely-named fonts excluding "@" fonts, which is designed for vertical text, in the ANSI character set

trans-unit.source: Enumerates all styles of "Arial" font in the ANSI character set

seg-source.mrk: Enumerates all styles of "Arial" font in the ANSI character set

target.mrk: Enumerates all styles of "Arial" font in the ANSI character set
